timeline.bodyText: Do we want MessageType keys to be namespaced? I feel like they should be to make it easier to distinguish between default types and other plugins' types, but also not sure if that causes issues with config
timeline.author: mdcfe

replies.bodyText: Namespacing seems like it would be a PITA for end-users, should be up to plugins to avoid conflicts with custom channel names.
replies.author: JRoy

replies.bodyText: I can see cases where multiple plugins might want to use several of these for different purposes (ie a factions plugin might want to broadcast join/leave messages related to joining/leaving factions, and servers might want those messages to go somewhere else). We could make the namespace prefix optional in the config, so users can choose to use chat to match any *:chat type or essentialsx:join/factions:join to configure those specific types independently?
replies.author: mdcfe

replies.bodyText:
This is most likely from Discord's stupid naming which treats/names it as an Integer while in reality it is more a Long.
See 2nd-last point in this Gist's section


The INTEGER type is always 53 bit precision (which would be a long in java)
replies.author: Andre601

replies.bodyText: andre is correct here, discord calls longs integers and when you register a command, the argument type is even called an INTEGER
replies.author: JRoy

timeline.bodyText: Translate?
timeline.author: mdcfe

replies.bodyText: At certain pre-planned points during the rotation of the 3rd planet from the Sun, known as Earth, myself and my companions, will participate in an event known as "trolling", where we attempt to trick people into performing certain humorous actions, such as, but not limited to, clicking a World Wide Web link which tricks the viewer into watching the music video for English singer and songwriter Rick Astley's debut single, "Never Gonna Give You Up", released on July 27, 1987, which is known as "Rickrolling" by Internet users. This prankery can be done ironically as a joke, or to genuinely upset the viewer. But one thing that this trickery does, is make the deceptive person laugh, due to the fact that the victim fell for such a humorous prank. For the victim, the deceptive person, known henceforth as the "troll", has done something evil, so vile that it makes the victim yell and/or scream in a fit of rage and then repeatedly smash their face and hands against their computer, possibly breaking hundreds of expensive components. But the troll keeps on laughing, uttering a common phrase used by internet trolls, "U mad bro?"
replies.author: JRoy

replies.author: Andre601

timeline.bodyText: Do commands feed back to the sender on Discord (beyond the console channel)? If so, how?
timeline.author: mdcfe

replies.bodyText:
Depends on context:
As for console command relay, (when console.command-relay is enabled) if you type in the console channel, the bot will reply (discord reply) to the user's message with the command output.
As for the slash command, the slash-command will have its response message edited with the command output.
What the two have in common:
DiscordCommandSender will check every 20ms if 1 second has passed without it receiving a message, if true, it dispatches a message with everything caught in its buffer. After 20 seconds of no messages received, DiscordCommandSender marks itself for garbage collection.
replies.author: JRoy

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,59 @@
+package net.essentialsx.api.v2.services.discord;
+
+/**
+ * A class which provides information about what triggered an interaction event.
+ */
+public interface InteractionEvent {
+    /**
+     * Creates/Appends the initial response message.
+     * @param message The message to append.
+     */
+    void reply(String message);
+
+    /**
+     * Gets the member which caused this event.
+     * @return the member which caused the event.
+     */
+    InteractionMember getMember();
+
+    /**
+     * Helper method to get the String representation of the argument by the given key or null if none by that key is present.
+     * @param key The key of the argument to lookup.
+     * @return the string value or null.
+     */
+    String getStringArgument(String key);
+
+    /**
+     * Helper method to get the Long representation of the argument by the given key or null if none by that key is present.

timeline.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: MD <1917406+mdcfe@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: Stupid and probably nitpicky question, but doesn't the fact that this is fired before the message is actually send to Discord make it a PreDiscordChatMessageEvent?
timeline.author: Andre601

replies.bodyText: The fact that it is Cancellable implies this itself. For example, AsyncPlayerChatEvent doesn't have a Pre in it even though it's dispatched before the chat message is sent.
replies.author: JRoy

timeline.bodyText: Maybe be a bit more clear that it's an event that (at least) extends InteractionEvent?
timeline.author: Andre601
timeline.diffHunk:

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change

timeline.author: mdcfe
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,67 @@
+package net.essentialsx.api.v2.services.discord;
+
+import java.util.List;
+import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
+
+/**
+ * Represents the interaction command executor as a guild member.
+ */
+public interface InteractionMember {
+    /**
+     * Gets the username of this member.
+     * @return this member's username.
+     */
+    String getName();
+
+    /**
+     * Gets the four numbers after the {@code #} in the member's username.
+     * @return this member's discriminator.
+     */
+    String getDiscriminator();
+
+    /**
+     * Gets this member's name and discriminator split by a {@code #}.
+     * @return this member's tag.
+     */
+    default String getTag() {
+        return getName() + "#" + getDiscriminator();
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Gets the nickname of this member or their username if they don't have one.
+     * @return this member's nickname or username if none is present.
+     */
+    String getEffectiveName();
+
+    /**
+     * Gets the nickname of this member or null if they do not have one.
+     * @return this member's nickname or null.
+     */
+    String getNickname();
+
+    /**
+     * Gets the ID of this member.
+     * @return this member's ID.
+     */
+    String getId();
+
+    /**
+     * Checks if this member has the administrator permission on discord.

timeline.author: mdcfe

timeline.author: mdcfe

timeline.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Co-authored-by: MD <1917406+mdcfe@users.noreply.github.com>
Validate message type key on constructor creation
Add EssentialsDiscord to Commandessentials version mismatch checker
Add net.essentialsx to checkstyle suppression filter

Exclude opus from JDA

We don't use audio stuff
Add support for competing activity type
Strip formatting from messages sent to Discord
Rename messages to message-types in config
Initial start at custom message system
Allow color codes to be sent from discord by certain roles

Filter role/here/everyone mentions from chat

People with `essentials.discord.ping` can bypass this

Add framework for sending console commands

This will ideally be moved to slash commands but this is a lose framework of a
TextChannel-reply based solution
Add config option for webhook name
Sanitize discord markdown from chat messages
Add `essentials.discord.markdown` permission to bypass markdown filter
Delay join messages to allow user data to load correctly
Add setting to restrict max discord message length

Docs LOL

Still need polish, am tired, save me
Fix message format for console message not being respected
Make discord administrators have all role permissions
You do not know what you're doing, I know what you're doing and I will tell you
ahaha i need to stash this away
Run isPermissionSet check for receiving chat messages
Add error for missing command scope
Add error for deleted console webhook
Prevent use of custom status as they are no supported for bots
Use AsyncUserDataLoadEvent to send join messages
Make AsyncUserDataLoadEvent use the actual join message (or none in silent join)
Add link to discord authorization page
Add option for permission-less environments to always receive primary messages

Strip Essentials format from prefix & suffix

Some permissions plugins (*cough* LuckPerms) keep prefixes and suffixes as
untranslated color codes causing them to show up in Discord with color codes.
Move webhook fetcher to a future based system
Add plugin name to console message
Add config options to show avatar and name for chat messages
Fix console webhook not surviving /ess reload
Allow all player-related message types to use advanced avatar/name
Bump JDA + Move to their maven repo
Add DiscordSRV to plugin version fetcher
Allow third-party type creation for DiscordMessageEvent

Vastly improve the provided APIs

Make them independent of any JDA api to ensure we can update it as we please
Fix NPE when PAPI was enabled and a format was not in the config
Don't send chat messages which are not seen by all people on discord
Add config option to filter discord messages

Shade slf4j

JDA requires slf4j (sadly) and spigot doesn't provide it!
We also cannot relocate it because JDA is JDA.
Fix channels not being resolved to the correct definition at all
Fix raw channel ids not resolving
Add some more debugs in DiscordListener
